title: About MF's scrapped VO, new VO and.. Aatrox
body:
The insight into why MF's VO was scrapped was pretty interesting. Thank you, Riot!

That's said, the main problem with scrapped new VO, in my understanding, was that the players divide in two groups: the ones that love their slutty pirate sexy, and the ones that love their ruthless Bilgewater bitch murder-y and scary. 
And that's really awesome for the MF's character. That makes her interesting, it gives her that vibe of a _good_, well-written character. I think, in her next VO we should preserve that.

Now to topics I want to ask and propose and discuss:

1.  If it's possible it would be cool to know what was the dominant side in that scrapped MF's VO. We sure need Rioter for that. Did they try to make her more ruthless and testing showed that she needs that sexy side of her? Did they try to have a balance between those 2 sides and just failed at it? What was the % between those two sides?
It would be really interesting and showed a lot of insight into _that_ side of gamedev, which is rarelly shown.

2. Now to her **next ** VO
As we establish we need two sides of her: sexy and flirtatious, and ruthless plus, in a way, real **Captain**. 
As writer for GG MF [said very well](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/OolUPfEj-what-do-you-want-to-see-in-miss-fortunes-voiceover-update?comment=001b):

>  So we went back to the drawing board and added a few more ruthless lines. The ones that worked best had a very distinct tonal shift -- she'd start at flirtatious, then shift her range into a darker, more threatening tone. The fantasy worked when she was always in control of the situation and knew it 100%, and that confidence was reflected in her dialogue -- whether she was flirting, fighting, or both.
> 

and:

>  I think she works best when the two distinct sides of her personality -- flirty and murdery --- are interwoven with a degree of self-confidence bordering on necessity. MF as a character needs that mountain of confidence because if she loses it, if she wavers even a little, she'll lose the aura of fear and respect around her and be killed in under an hour - she knows this, and plays everyone accordingly. That means her sexuality, her power, her decision making, her ruthlessness, her ability to deliberately drop a dude pleading for his life and dump him into the bay -- it all needs to be tied into this aura of extreme confidence, like she could never be wrong no matter what decision she's making, and no matter what mask she's wearing at the time. Like even though she's not forcing you to fall for her, her presence is so commanding that you could never say no.
> 

Sure, it was said about GG MF, but, I think, it captured whole essence of MF's character.
 Confidence is her main trait. _Not even like that._ **CONFIDENCE** is MF's main trait. It's behind, behind the curtain of her whole persona. It's confidence that make her this flurtatious: confidence that MF would pull this trick of seducing and that she _can_ do it if she just want to. Also confidence is behind that MF's ruthless persona: she knows that she could be that ruthless, murder-y person cause she needs to.
MF is not just a Captain, she confident she **_is_ the Captain**, that certain actions are needed to be the **real Captain**.
That's what her VO must express.

Also, girls and women do like to play as MF. And that confidence is, I think, why. MF is the woman that her confidence truly empowers her, even if she is flirty at the moment. Confidence is beneath her whole persona, it's like MF's foundation.

* Now to the last bit. As Rioters said many times that balance between two sides of MF (sexy and ruthless) is very fragile. It's very hard to preserve that balance, and the first attempt failed at it.

I think the solution is in **Aatrox's VO** {{champion:266}} . So yeah, yeah, we all know that Aatrox's VO was heavily.. discussed by community. But hear me out.

So the main reason why people disliked Aatrox's new VO cause they thought it was very shouty. The big reason behind it was cause SkinSpotlight's interactions video was uploaded before the whole picture. And in interactions with champions Aatrox tries to engage his enemy. Come! Fight! 
Then community heard the whole VO, with theese moments of existential crisis. Not only shouty bits, but also his sadness. Aatrox's VO is absolutely stunning in that field. It creates that awesome character. And theese two sides create one compelling and _good_ character

And **that** is what MF need. The VO that creates charater. So, apart from the fact that her confidence should be her cornerstone, that is how, I think, her VO should be built:

**Most of her normal lines should be ruthless, and most of the interactions should be flirty.**

So, MF, as we know, uses that sexy, so she can empower herself; it helps her with establishing power in Bilgewater, she is cunning, she is smart; and her "sexy" is just that facade.  Champion interactions symbolise how they interacts with the rest champions. Her interactions should show how she engages others, how she communicate. Not all of the interactions should be flirty, but a big number of should be. And not flirty ones should be ruthless. Like really ruthless. And then, we (as players) see more of her confident and ruthless side when she says things during long movements and etc. Don't forget about **confidence**! It's her main persona, trait! 

So, her "with the world" communications should be more flirty and some ruthless and "I'm with myself" should be all "I'm a **Captain**" and some ruthless.
Just like Aatrox's VO where we saw one side of character in interactions nad we saw another side of character in his long movements.

I think that approach could make a great MF's VO and would make the creation of that VO easier

-------------------------------------------------------
Thank you for reading, sorry for my english, let's discuss :) Thank you

replies.body:
Yeah your argument is pretty well thought out (though a tad wordy in its presentation (an edit might get more readers fyi)).  

But yah I think i agree “confidence” is a key trait to get across, but my question would be what does she “want” from other characters during a fight or what does she “want” from a fight (validation, adoration, attention, to lose the self etc...).  
 I.e Aatrox wants to be distracted from the horror of his fall, Rakan wants attention and excitement... etc...

My guess is MF wants... to hint that she has an ace up her sleeve. ....possibly to show she has control.  But  I havent given it much thought yet. (And never heard the new test VO)

(Edited 2 obvious typos)

Personally, I think MF just wants control. Control over the life that was thrown in disarray by Gangplank. Control over others so that it never happens again. It's why she's a captain and why she stuck around after sinking Gangplank - she took his place and the unofficial leader off Bilgewater so she could have more control.\


Edit: Also, I think her flirty side goes with this really well. I don't think its all a charade, but I do think she recognizes the advantages it bring sand uses it accordingly. I would also like to point out that it is possible to be flirty without actually wanting to sleep with everyone. I think mF just has fun doing it, genuine fun, but at the same time she also recognizes the benefits, so its a win-win for her.

Yeah, I think it’s possible to see her flirty and treasing lines as a way of exerting control and displaying power.  It’s like a bluff in poker —maybe she has all the aces and maybe she doesnt— but she likes you wondering why she’s so confident.

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=cymx9oUZ,comment-id=000100040000,timestamp=2018-10-15T16:23:29.951+0000)
>
> Yeah, I think it’s possible to see her flirty and treasing lines as a way of exerting control and displaying power.  It’s like a bluff in poker —maybe she has all the aces and maybe she doesnt— but she likes you wondering why she’s so confident.

Damn it, WAAARGHbobo. Now you have me with a document open writing down Miss Fortune line concepts. I HAD THINGS TO DO.

...but I do actually like some of these.
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
I'm not sure it's an accurate comparison, but how do you feel about Fujiko Mine? To me, that's a mix of sexy ruthlessness with confidence.

Flirty and controlling lines are good, but as The Djinn mention her also showing that she believes things are better with her around and how she didnt really want to control but was forced too for the greater good are also important aspects. It would be nice during her idle or death you can hear her mutter to herself how tough it is putting up this act and how she never had a choice to be where she is now.

My only issue is that it doesn't really show that flirty side the way the game does in the comics and stories. Kinda makes this fractured narrative about her character that's weird when you focus only on one side of her - flirty or badass.

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=cymx9oUZ,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-10-15T04:32:24.899+0000)My guess is MF wants... to hint that she has an ace up her sleeve. ....possibly to show she has control.  But  I havent given it much thought yet. [And never heard the new test VO]

I'd argue it's a bit more than that -- hinting isn't enough if someone tries to call her bluff in force. Showing control, yes, but I think her main goal is two-fold: show that she's definitively in charge and that crossing her will get you killed, but also showing that things are *better* when she's in charge, and that she's preferable to GP. I think the key difference between Miss Fortune and Gangplank is that Miss Fortune, while a dangerous, often merciless pirate, isn't as likely to turn on you on a whim. Bilgewater under MF is safer for *her* allies than Bilgerwater under GP is for *his* allies.

As a result, I can see her as threatening, flirty, powerful, or even outright friendly (in that you-and-I-can-do-great-things sort of way) based on whether a given champion is a threat, a potential ally, or a unknown quantity.

For example, Illaoi is likely a valuable ally and, while she used to be Gangplank's implied lover, both MF and Illaoi seem like the sort who wouldn't let that get in the way of a powerful alliance if it was beneficial to both. Graves and Twisted Fate are unknowns, but Graves probably responds better to being shown toughness, while I could see TF receiving more of the flirtatious side, with the goal of making sure neither try to cross her.

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=cymx9oUZ,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-10-15T04:32:24.899+0000)
>
> Yeah your argument is pretty well thought out (though a tad wordy in its presentation (an edit might get more readers fyi)).  
> 
> But yah I think i agree “confidence” is a key trait to get across, but my question would be what does she “want” from other characters during a fight orwhat does she “want” from a fight (validation, adoration, attention, to lose the self etc...).   I.e Aatrox want to be distracted from the horror of his fall, Rakan wants attention and excitement... etc...
> 
> My guess is MF wants... to hint that she has an ace up her sleeve. ....possibly to show she has control.  But  I havent given it much thought yet. (And never heard the new test VO)

Isn't it possible to get her old voice actress for the new Voice lines? I think everyone would be happy with that.

I didn’t write or direct the test RW,  so not sure the reasons here.  Often new talent is often required because of schedualing problems, new colors in the acting, or unfortunately the actor’s voice age.  
An actor’s voice ages as they do or from straining work— ussually slower than an actors appearance, but you can hear when a 40 year old woman is trying to sound 20.     Again I don’t know in this instance but we always try to hear the original talent.
Are you writing these on a mobile device?  Quite a few typos and grammar errors here.
always

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=cymx9oUZ,comment-id=00010001000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-15T21:23:20.014+0000)
>
> always

One of Us

{{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}

Seeing as how league hasn't been around for 20 years I'd imagine a 20 something year old voice artist would still be in their late 20's/early 30's. Also isn't sound design and engineering a thing? I'm pretty sure it could be pitched up subtly? *Shrugs*
Yup, but yet a lot of them are still cast as youthful characters unfortunately.
Yeah Dawson Casting is kind of annoying.

It appears a person has to make a full on Boards post that could suffice as a comment. I'll post my previous reply then that nobody seemed to notice before that caught this much earlier.

> MF as far as i can tell has two faces. One is the flirty side to get what she wants in order to charm people, especially men into her service through flirtation and flattering but beneath that she is someone who is extremely driven towards her goals because of all the pain she suffered through GP's doing and the trials by fire she went through in a stinking shit pile of a city called "Bilgewater". She didn't choose that life, but she chose to not surrender to it.

> Balance flirtation with badassery with a 30 - 70 ratio respectively. I doubt she's the snobby Ahri-type "biatch" that Ahri's SG or the upcoming KDA skin seems to be like. Show her true colors but don't lose her charm and you have her personality captured in an interesting dynamic of conviction and fun. She isn't Xayah. She isn't that childish.

30/70 isn't good.

More like 60/60

Yes that adds up to 120.

She needs lines that mix flirty and ruthless.

She also needs lines that are solely flirty or solely ruthless.

And it needs to be equal.

Her flirty side isn't a facade, she's just flirty.
No... its a facade. She isn't actually interested in sleeping with all the men of Bilgewater, she just makes them think that for a moment.

It is most assuredly not a facade.

She doesnt want to sleep with everyone no but shes never expressed that sentiment at any time.

She just flirts a lot.

This isn't reflected in the lore. The lore in fact supports that it is a facade. 

She is one of the most developed and used characters in the lore and most of what we see is her bad ass or cold killer side. She is almost exclusively flirtatious for when it benefits her in other ways.

Her very first line in Fortune Smiles is a sassy remark that shes worth the wait.

It has no undertone or ulterior motive, just purely her being a tease.

And the lore explicitly states she is unmatched in beauty and danger.  Her own writer says she has a flirty nature.

Despite what you want to think Miss Fortune is flirty.
I didn't claim she was never flirty. I acknowledged it actually.

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=cymx9oUZ,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-10-15T04:32:24.899+0000)
>
> Yeah your argument is pretty well thought out (though a tad wordy in its presentation (an edit might get more readers fyi)).  
> 
> But yah I think i agree “confidence” is a key trait to get across, but my question would be what does she “want” from other characters during a fight or what does she “want” from a fight (validation, adoration, attention, to lose the self etc...).  
>  I.e Aatrox wants to be distracted from the horror of his fall, Rakan wants attention and excitement... etc...
> 
> My guess is MF wants... to hint that she has an ace up her sleeve. ....possibly to show she has control.  But  I havent given it much thought yet. (And never heard the new test VO)
> 
> (Edited 2 obvious typos)

I hope that all this discussion will help Riot in creating a VO that all the players will really appreciate when it eventually comes around. I'm already pumped to see (or hear rather) the quality of her lines since you guys have been knocking it out of the park with VOs like Aatrox and Nunu! 

{{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}

I think she enjoys shooting/killing them, as well as a few innuendos.
I think that GGMF's VO captures the enjoyment of fighting, but is lacking in the other side of her humour.

I don't think that she wants to taunt that she has control (I doubt she cares) moreso than she knows she's going to win.

Have you thought about in and out of combat character switching?  MF could be an easygoing character who occasionally flirts when doing out-of-combat stuff, but entering combat could put her into tough mode.  Plenty of characters do this.

Walking: “Bilgewater, this ain’t!  But I don’t mind.” “Time for a stroll.”
Warding: “Stay here, cutie, and watch my back.” “Take a peek for me.”
Potion: “Well, better than grog!” “Tastes as good as it feels.”

Attacking: “I got plenty where this came from.” “Bring it!” “Light ‘em up!”
Q: “Get some!” “Ka-bounce!”
W: “Move!  Move!”
E: “Feel the rain—feel the pain!”
R: (maniacal laughing)

>Attacking: "I got plenty where this came from." (Seriously, {{champion:29}} carries a lot of ammo)

Back on topic, I like your example lines. It does share a couple lines with {{champion:99}} {{champion:122}} too but, thats not a bad thing nor avoidable in a game with 140+ characters.
Ahem, it’s “Let’s light ‘em up!” for Lux. UwU

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=cymx9oUZ,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-10-15T04:32:24.899+0000)
>
> Yeah your argument is pretty well thought out (though a tad wordy in its presentation (an edit might get more readers fyi)).  
> 
> But yah I think i agree “confidence” is a key trait to get across, but my question would be what does she “want” from other characters during a fight or what does she “want” from a fight (validation, adoration, attention, to lose the self etc...).  
>  I.e Aatrox wants to be distracted from the horror of his fall, Rakan wants attention and excitement... etc...
> 
> My guess is MF wants... to hint that she has an ace up her sleeve. ....possibly to show she has control.  But  I havent given it much thought yet. (And never heard the new test VO)
> 
> (Edited 2 obvious typos)

Too much conviction and/or energy too often in the VO lines can be polarizing, and lead to love/hate opinions.  I would pick carefully what lines you want a champ to be known for and defines him or her.  "Surpass the frailty of your form."
Speaking of which when is Ezreals' VO gonna be posted on the wiki? It's a bit of an Aatrox situation where we don't have all the lines available so it's hard not to make generalizations about it.

I can't wait Ahri's VO.
Because she need interaction with Wukong.
they should keep both. her classic skin gets her sexy voice lines and Captain MF gets her Dominant, scary voice lines.

> [{quoted}](name=Goblin Ranger,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=cymx9oUZ,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2018-10-15T07:46:22.925+0000)
>
> they should keep both. her classic skin gets her sexy voice lines and Captain MF gets her Dominant, scary voice lines.

Not unless Captain becomes free like Captain GP...

I'd rather not have a repeat of Spirit Guard Udyr, where everything you could want from a rework is in the form of a skin.

Honestly i'm a bit sad that Riot weren't successful in finding an appropriate voice direction for MF but i'm even more sad that there's absolutely no news on the Varus VO Update. As he was also promised one, alongside MF.
I just hope MF's keeps the essence of confident, but remembers MF knowledge of being confident instead of being cocky. It is one of my favorite lines by her.

No, we hated the Aatrox VO because it has nothing to do with the original character and it makes laughing stock of who he was.
Failure of a rework...

Not sure why Riot doesn't just give you pre-game options in the champion tab to choose old VO or new ones

That would solve all their fan-base-having-issues-with-the-new-voice problems

Pretty sure Aatrox players at least would be happy with that.

Traditional skins! I don't know why Riot stopped making those.

 {{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

Dude I wouldn't call Aatrox VO such a masterpiece.

That may come as a very unpopular personal opinion,  but it's very cringey, laughably edgy and tries way too hard to be "poetic" (and it fails equally hard at that).
 
The shouting with that accent is constant and unsufferable. I literally had to turn the champion volume to 0 when I played him... That's not a joke

They took away the "War is art" persona he used to have, and that makes me not want to play him. 
I guess from Riot's perspective it was too similar to Jhin but then they made his kit just {{champion:92}} thats more balanced for pro play rather than low elo games.

Not reading this, too long. But it looks like it took effort, and theres pretty much nothing about MF I could care about in terms of a rework. 

Take my upvote, Good luck with whatever it is you want. ^.^
aatrox's VO is an utterly mess and it's incomplete. it was rushed and it totally chanched the way people thought about him

What? Haha Aatrox' VO is pure garbage in it's entirety. Even his "sad" parts are like melancholic Dracula, trying to quote Shakespeare. He couldn't get any more generic as a villain.

Among all others, i have heard only one line from Aatrox that truly works, even with this voice actor because it is so well written you can't mess it up.

{{champion:266}} "I am not a god, i am not a king I AM..............worse.."
i didnt read any of this but it was long and you probably put a lot of effort into this post +1 upvote
